intro: Cuviera nigrescens, commonly known as the black-stemmed cupuaçu, is a tropical plant native to the Amazon Basin. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems that turn dark as they mature. The plant produces large, edible fruits that are rich in nutrients and have a distinctive flavor. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, often used in traditional medicine. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
